y2='240' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='60' y1='240' x2='60' y2='60' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='365' y='244' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='44' y='56' font-size='10'>4</text><line x1='240' y1='240' x2='240' y2='246' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:1' /><text x='236' y='262' font-size='10'>6</text><line x1='300' y1='240' x2='300' y2='246' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:1' /><text x='296' y='262' font-size='10'>8</text><line x1='360' y1='240' x2='360' y2='246' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:1' /><text x='352' y='262' font-size='10'>10</text><line x1='54' y1='240' x2='60' y2='240' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='36' y='244' font-size='10'>0</text><line x1='54' y1='204' x2='60' y2='204' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:1' /><text x='30' y='208' font-size='10'>10</text><line x1='54' y1='168' x2='60' y2='168' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:1' /><text x='30' y='172' font-size='10'>20</text><line x1='54' y1='132' x2='60' y2='132' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:1' /><text x='30' y='136' font-size='10'>30</text><line x1='54' y1='96' x2='60' y2='96' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:1' /><text x='30' y='100' font-size='10'>40</text><line x1='54' y1='60' x2='60' y2='60' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:1' /><text x='30' y='64' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot with 8 points showing a strong positive linear association.
questions.question: Based on the scatterplot, which statement best describes the relationship between x and y?

options.A: There is a strong positive linear association.
options.B: There is a weak positive linear association.
options.C: There is little to no association.
options.D: There is a strong negative linear association.

questions.explanation: As x increases, y generally increases, and the points cluster close to a line, indicating a strong positive linear association.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For association questions, focus on direction (up/down) and how tightly points follow a line.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='60' y1='240' x2='360' y2='240' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='60' y1='240' x2='60' y2='60' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='365' y='244' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='44' y='56' font-size='12'>y</text><line x1='60' y1='240' x2='360' y2='60' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2' /><circle cx='90' cy='218' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='182' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='180' cy='164' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='240' cy='128' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='330' cy='74' r='3' fill='black' /><text x='56' y='262' font-size='10'>0</text><text x='116' y='262' font-size='10'>2</text><text x='176' y='262' font-size='10'>4</text><text x='236' y='262' font-size='10'>6</text><text x='296' y='262' font-size='10'>8</text><text x='352' y='262' font-size='10'>10</text><text x='30' y='244' font-size='10'>0</text><text x='30' y='208' font-size='10'>10</text><text x='30' y='172' font-size='10'>20</text><text x='30' y='136' font-size='10'>30</text><text x='30' y='100' font-size='10'>40</text><text x='30' y='64' font-size='10'>50</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot with a line of best fit rising from (0,0) to (10,50).
questions.question: Which of the following is closest to the slope of the line of best fit shown in the scatterplot?
questions.explanation: The line goes from approximately (0,0) to (10,50). The slope is <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>50</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Estimate slope using two clear points on the line of best fit (rise over run).

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='60' y1='240' x2='360' y2='240' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='60' y1='240' x2='60' y2='60' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='365' y='244' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='44' y='56' font-size='12'>y</text><line x1='60' y1='78' x2='360' y2='186' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2' /><circle cx='90' cy='92' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='120' cy='114' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='180' cy='140' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='240' cy='164' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='186' r='3' fill='black' /><text x='56' y='262' font-size='10'>0</text><text x='116' y='262' font-size='10'>2</text><text x='176' y='262' font-size='10'>4</text><text x='236' y='262' font-size='10'>6</text><text x='296' y='262' font-size='10'>8</text><text x='352' y='262' font-size='10'>10</text><text x='30' y='244' font-size='10'>0</text><text x='30' y='208' font-size='10'>10</text><text x='30' y='172' font-size='10'>20</text><text x='30' y='136' font-size='10'>30</text><text x='30' y='100' font-size='10'>40</text><text x='30' y='64' font-size='10'>50</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot with a line of best fit showing a negative linear trend and y-intercept near 45.
questions.question: Which equation best represents the line of best fit shown?
questions.explanation: The line slopes downward (negative slope) and crosses the y-axis at about 45, so <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>45</mn></math> matches.
questions.score_improvement_tip: From a graph, check slope sign first, then estimate the y-intercept.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='60' y1='240' x2='360' y2='240' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='60' y1='240' x2='60' y2='60' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='365' y='244' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='44' y='56' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='120' cy='190' r='4' fill='black' /><circle cx='270' cy='136' r='4' fill='black' /><line x1='60' y1='212' x2='360' y2='104' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2' /><text x='108' y='184' font-size='10'>(2,14)</text><text x='258' y='130' font-size='10'>(7,29)</text><text x='56' y='262' font-size='10'>0</text><text x='116' y='262' font-size='10'>2</text><text x='176' y='262' font-size='10'>4</text><text x='236' y='262' font-size='10'>6</text><text x='296' y='262' font-size='10'>8</text><text x='352' y='262' font-size='10'>10</text><text x='30' y='244' font-size='10'>0</text><text x='30' y='208' font-size='10'>10</text><text x='30' y='172' font-size='10'>20</text><text x='30' y='136' font-size='10'>30</text><text x='30' y='100' font-size='10'>40</text><text x='30' y='64' font-size='10'>50</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Graph showing two labeled points (2,14) and (7,29) and a line through them.
questions.question: A line of best fit for a data set passes through the points (2, 14) and (7, 29). What is the slope of the line? Enter your answer as a decimal or fraction.
questions.explanation: Slope is <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>29</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>14</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>15</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For slope, subtract y-values over subtracting x-values in the same order.

questions.question: A company tracks the relationship between weekly advertising cost x (in dollars) and the number of new customers y. A line of best fit is given by <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.04</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></math>. Which statement best interprets the slope in this context?

options.A: For each additional $1 spent, the predicted number of new customers increases by 0.04.
options.B: For each additional $1 spent, the predicted number of new customers increases by 12.
options.C: When $0 is spent, the predicted number of new customers is 0.04.
options.D: When $0 is spent, the predicted number of new customers is 12.

questions.explanation: The slope is 0.04, meaning y increases by 0.04 for each 1-unit increase in x (each $1).
questions.score_improvement_tip: Slope is the predicted change in y for a 1-unit increase in x.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='60' y1='240' x2='360' y2='240' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='60' y1='240' x2='60' y2='60' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='365' y='244' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='44' y='56' font-size='12'>y</text><line x1='60' y1='222' x2='360' y2='114' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2' /><circle cx='240' cy='168' r='4' fill='black' /><text x='226' y='160' font-size='10'>(6,20)</text><text x='56' y='262' font-size='10'>0</text><text x='116' y='262' font-size='10'>2</text><text x='176' y='262' font-size='10'>4</text><text x='236' y='262' font-size='10'>6</text><text x='296' y='262' font-size='10'>8</text><text x='352' y='262' font-size='10'>10</text><text x='30' y='244' font-size='10'>0</text><text x='30' y='208' font-size='10'>10</text><text x='30' y='172' font-size='10'>20</text><text x='30' y='136' font-size='10'>30</text><text x='30' y='100' font-size='10'>40</text><text x='30' y='64' font-size='10'>50</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Graph with a labeled data point (6,20) and a line of best fit.
questions.question: The line of best fit for a data set is <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. The scatterplot includes the point (6, 20). What is the residual for this point?
questions.explanation: Predicted value at <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math> is <math><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>17</mn></math>. Residual <math><mo>=</mo><mtext>actual</mtext><mo>-</mo><mtext>predicted</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>17</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Residual = actual y-value minus predicted y-value from the model.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='60' y1='240' x2='360' y2='240' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='60' y1='240' x2='60' y2='60' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='365' y='244' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='44' y='56' font-size='12'>y</text><line x1='60' y1='233' x2='360' y2='89' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2' /><text x='56' y='262' font-size='10'>0</text><text x='116' y='262' font-size='10'>2</text><text x='176' y='262' font-size='10'>4</text><text x='236' y='262' font-size='10'>6</text><text x='296' y='262' font-size='10'>8</text><text x='352' y='262' font-size='10'>10</text><text x='30' y='244' font-size='10'>0</text><text x='30' y='208' font-size='10'>10</text><text x='30' y='172' font-size='10'>20</text><text x='30' y='136' font-size='10'>30</text><text x='30' y='100' font-size='10'>40</text><text x='30' y='64' font-size='10'>50</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Graph with a line of best fit rising and passing near (0,2) and (10,42).
questions.question: A line of best fit is shown in the graph. What y-value does the line predict when <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math>? Enter your answer as an integer.
questions.explanation: From the graph, the line is consistent with <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. At <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math>, <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>38</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Use two easy-to-read points on the line to build an equation, then substitute.

questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot with values increasing slowly at first and then more rapidly, suggesting curved growth.
questions.question: Which model is most appropriate for the relationship shown in the scatterplot?

options.D: No model because there is no association

questions.explanation: The <math><mi>y</mi></math>-values increase at an increasing rate as <math><mi>x</mi></math> increases, which is characteristic of exponential growth.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To choose a model, look for constant differences (linear) versus constant ratios (exponential) and curve shape (quadratic).

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='80.0' cy='226.2' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='97.1' cy='202.4' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='114.3' cy='211.0' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='131.4' cy='181.7' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='148.6' cy='173.1' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='165.7' cy='171.0' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='182.9' cy='158.6' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200.0' cy='146.6' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='217.1' cy='132.5' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='234.3' cy='136.5' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='251.4' cy='107.7' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='268.6' cy='127.6' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='285.7' cy='90.5' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='302.9' cy='118.6' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='320.0' cy='94.8' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='290.0' cy='225.0' r='4' fill='red' /><text x='300.0' y='225.0' font-size='10' fill='red'>outlier</text><line x1='50.0' y1='225.0' x2='350.0' y2='75.0' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2;stroke-dasharray:5,5' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot with a positive linear trend and one red outlier far from the trend.
questions.question: The scatterplot shows a positive linear trend with one outlier (shown in red). If the outlier is removed, what is the most likely effect on the strength of the linear association?
questions.explanation: The main cluster follows a clear positive line. An outlier away from the pattern typically weakens the linear association, so removing it generally increases <math><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>r</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Outliers that do not follow the trend usually reduce the strength of linear association.

questions.question: A data set includes the points (1, 7), (3, 11), (5, 15), and (7, 19). Which equation best models the relationship between x and y?
questions.explanation: The change in y is 4 when x increases by 2, so slope is <math><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. Using (1,7): <math><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math> gives <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>, so <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For linear data, find slope from consecutive points, then use one point to find the intercept.

questions.question: For a data set, a line of best fit is <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>0.4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>22</mn></math>. A new data set is created by adding 8 to every y-value from the original data set. Which equation could be a line of best fit for the new data set?
questions.explanation: Adding 8 to every y-value shifts the line up by 8. The slope stays the same and the y-intercept increases by 8: <math><mn>22</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Vertical shifts (adding to y) change only the intercept, not the slope.

questions.question: A data set has a line of best fit <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></math>. A new data set is created by replacing each x-value with <math><mi>x</mi><mo>'</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi></math> while keeping each y-value the same. Which equation expresses y in terms of <math><mi>x</mi><mo>'</mo></math> for a line of best fit of the new data set?
questions.explanation: Since <math><mi>x</mi><mo>'</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi></math>, then <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>'</mo></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>. Substitute into <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></math>: <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>'</mo></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>'</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When x is scaled, rewrite x in terms of the new variable before substituting into the model.

questions.question: A data set is modeled by <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi></msup></math>, where a and b are positive constants. Two points on the model are (1, 12) and (4, 96). What is the value of b? Enter your answer as an integer or decimal.
questions.explanation: From the points, <math><mn>12</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>1</mn></msup></math> and <math><mn>96</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>4</mn></msup></math>. Divide to eliminate a: <math><mfrac><mn>96</mn><mn>12</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>4</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>1</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math>. Since <math><mfrac><mn>96</mn><mn>12</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math>, we have <math><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math>, so <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For exponential models, divide y-values to eliminate a and solve for the base b.

questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot showing growth that accelerates as x increases, consistent with an exponential model.
questions.question: The scatterplot suggests an exponential relationship between x and y. Which transformation would most directly produce an approximately linear plot to help estimate model parameters?
questions.explanation: If <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi></msup></math>, then <math><mi>ln</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mi>ln</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></math>, which is linear in <math><mi>x</mi></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For exponential models, take a logarithm of y to convert multiplicative growth into an additive linear form.

questions.question: A line of best fit for a data set is written as <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math>. The mean of the x-values is 6 and the mean of the y-values is 15. If <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>, what is the value of b?
questions.explanation: A least-squares line passes through <math><mo>(</mo><mover><mi>x</mi><mo>¯</mo></mover><mo>,</mo><mover><mi>y</mi><mo>¯</mo></mover><mo>)</mo></math>. So <math><mn>15</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math>, giving <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>27</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Use the fact that the regression line passes through (mean x, mean y).

questions.question: A line of best fit is <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5.4</mn></math>. What x-value corresponds to the predicted value <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>23.4</mn></math>? Enter your answer as an integer.
questions.explanation: Solve <math><mn>23.4</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>1.8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5.4</mn></math>. Subtract 5.4: <math><mn>18</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>1.8</mn><mi>x</mi></math>. Divide by 1.8: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When given a prediction, substitute and solve for x like a linear equation.

questions.question: A line of best fit for a data set is <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math>. A new data set is created by multiplying every y-value by <math><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> (that is, <math><mi>y</mi><mo>'</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi></math>). Which equation gives the line of best fit for the new data set in terms of x?
questions.explanation: Since <math><mi>y</mi><mo>'</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi></math> and <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math>, then <math><mi>y</mi><mo>'</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>b</mi></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When transforming y-values, apply the transformation to the entire expression y = mx + b.

questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot with a curved pattern forming a downward-opening parabola.
questions.question: The relationship in the scatterplot is modeled by <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></math>, where <math><mi>a</mi></math> and <math><mi>c</mi></math> are constants. Which statement must be true about <math><mi>a</mi></math>?

options.D: <math><mi>a</mi></math> cannot be determined from the scatterplot

questions.explanation: The points form a downward-opening curve. In <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></math>, a downward-opening parabola requires <math><mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For quadratic models, the sign of the leading coefficient tells whether the parabola opens up or down.

questions.question_chart_description: Graph showing a line of best fit and a labeled point (8, 7.8).
questions.question: A line of best fit is <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.75</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2.1</mn></math>. The data set includes the point (8, 7.8). What is the residual for this point? Enter your answer as a decimal.
questions.explanation: Predicted <math><mi>y</mi></math> at <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math> is <math><mn>0.75</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2.1</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2.1</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>8.1</mn></math>. Residual is <math><mn>7.8</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>8.1</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>0.3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Keep signs straight: residual is actual minus predicted, so it can be negative.

questions.question: A set of data points has a positive linear association. A new data set is created by adding the same constant to every x-value. Which statement is true about the association and a line of best fit?

options.A: The slope stays the same, and the correlation stays the same.
options.B: The slope changes, and the correlation changes.
options.C: The slope stays the same, but the correlation becomes zero.

questions.explanation: Adding a constant to every x-value shifts the data horizontally. This does not change the direction/strength of the linear association or the slope, but it shifts the intercept.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Horizontal or vertical shifts do not change correlation and do not change slope; they change intercept/location.
